TopicTitle: My super heavy Saturn V Varient (Thor Mun Rocket)

Articles.Content:
So I had a nutty idea...

Take the Thor Mun Rocket of the Nova Punch pack, remove the first stage, radially re attach it and add fuel, and multiply it 4x. This is the result:
Ok wtf It won't allow me to post my picture...

http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198087373220/screenshots/

If this doesn't work, then I'm freaking lost...

First, how does it fly?

Second, what's the fuel consumption like?

Third, Where's the .craft file? haha
Thank you Nutt, and yes thats it.

1. Mech Jeb is your best friend, and its rather heavy, so movement is slow...

2. I made it to orbital altitude in 1 stage lol

3. Not entirely sure how to do that but I think have an idea of how to do it...

3. Not entirely sure how to do that but I think have an idea of how to do it...

If it gets to orbital altitude in 1 stage, that MIGHT be interplanetary capable... Not sure, though.

In the main KSP folder go to Ships>VAB>whatever you named the ship. Then copy that file and put it on dropbox or something similar.

If it gets to orbital altitude in 1 stage, that MIGHT be interplanetary capable... Not sure, though.

In the main KSP folder go to Ships>VAB>whatever you named the ship. Then copy that file and put it on dropbox or something similar.

Is there a free version of that?

Hate to sound cheap... But Moneys is short
You can also use MediaFire, which is free. Just drag 'n drop your .craft file from the saves folder and it'll give you a link to copy.

Yes, Dropbox is free.

Ok I'll try that in the next few days

Didnt actually think anybody would find my rocket worth downloading lol
